data.title: Get Current Census Data for Marianna, FL
data.meta_description: Need Marianna demographics? Get current population, race, age, income & poverty statistics for Marianna, FL from the US Census Bureau.
data.text:
Sources: United States Census Bureau. 2022 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates. U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey Office. Web. 7 December 2023.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2023. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2024. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2010 to July 1, 2019. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2021. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. "P2 Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino by Race." 2020 Census State Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 Census. Web. 12 August 2021. https://www.census.gov/.

Check out our FAQs for more details.

Population

With 7,294 people, Marianna is the 393rd most populated city in the state of Florida out of 952 cities. But watch out, Marianna, because Perry with 7,281 people and Clewiston with 7,238 people are right behind you.

Race & Ethnicity

The largest Marianna racial/ethnic groups are Black (49.7%) followed by White (44.9%) and Hispanic (3.2%).

Median Income

In 2022, the median household income of Marianna households was $27,296. Marianna households made slightly more than Waldo households ($27,258) and Wausau households ($27,083) . However, 25.1% of Marianna families live in poverty.

Median Age

The median age for Marianna residents is 38.2 years young.
